results.title: The Rising sun
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War in the Air”.
The opening of the air war in the Far East, 1941 to early 1943. The story of air power and its impact on the world from the 1940s and 1950s.

results.title: Past and future
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, John Elliot and BBC
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War in the Air”.
A discussion of the ways in which aeroplanes have been developed since the First World War as a pointer to the way they will develop in the future. A brief resume of the development of the warplane from the First to the Second World War, and of the strategic implications of new weapons in modern air war. Atomic and hydrogen bomb experiments; modern defences - fighter, radar, rockets; long range offensive weapons - rockets, carrier forces, V bombers; and lastly, the web of strategic air forces covering a diminished world.

results.title: Desert Air Force
results.creator_credit: Philip Dorte, Kenneth Rick and BBC Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “War in the Air”.
The air defence of the Middle East from Italy’s‘ entry into the war in Summer 1940 to the establishment of an advance wing of the Desert Air Force in Tripoli at the end of 1942.

results.title: The Australian airman: 1939-1945
results.creator_credit: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “War Experience”.
The men who served in the Royal Australian Air Force during the Second World War. At first it was a European war - over Germany, France, and Italy, but then the allies were driven back over North Africa. The Japanese aggression brought the men back to Australian shores and Pacific islands. Joining the Air Force with a spirit of adventure, the close of the war saw broken spirits and mental and physical suffering.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Writers Talking
results.brief_description: An insightful series of documentary portraits of Australian writers made with the assistance of the Archival Film Program and Literary Arts Board of the Australia Council.

results.title: Roland Robinson
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
A poet with a strong attachment to the Australian landscape, Roland Robinson has a deep interest in Aboriginal lore, and performs his poetry with a memorable verve.

results.title: Peter Porter
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
From his book-crammed London flat, Peter Porter introduces a variety of his best-known poems and presents his accessible and humane intelligence.

results.title: Randolph Stow
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Filmed on location in the landscapes of Suffolk and East Angliam, his present home, Randolf Stow talks of his life and shares examples of his poetry and prose.

results.title: David Malouf: an imaginary life
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Writers Talking”.
Poet and novelist David Malouf was filmed in Tuscany, Italy, during the coldest winter there for 50 years, and in Sydney during a steamy summer. To write, he says, you must turn your back on even the most beautiful landscape. Malouf talks about the influences on his work and how he gets into the writing process.
